title: TCP Extended Statistics MIB
abstract:
This document describes extended performance statistics for TCP.  They are
designed to use TCP's ideal vantage point to diagnose performance problems in
both the network and the application.  If a network-based application is
performing poorly, TCP can determine if the bottleneck is in the sender, the
receiver, or the network itself.  If the bottleneck is in the network, TCP can
provide specific information about its nature.  [STANDARDS-TRACK]
